data.text:
The story of RS77 nr. 6081523.

20.feb 2016: As seen on http://r100rs.nl/showroom-2/372/ ----

From: Michel Groeneveld <michelgroeneveld@casema.nl> Date: March 3, 2009, It s been a while visiting the RS77 site. My bike is still pleasing, very ok, going strong. Nothing much intresting to add thow. Adding therefore some (older) pictures of 6081523. See you.

Michel Groeneveld The Netherlands

----

Date: May 25, 2005 From: Michel Groeneveld E-mail address: michelgroeneveld@casema.nl Update on bike: 6081523 City/Region: De Bilt / Utrecht Mileage is: 55.000 kms History: 55.000 kms / Stil going great Repairs & mods: Needs: Else:

Monday, June 18, 2001

From: Michel Groeneveld, E-mail: michel.groeneveld@worldonline.nl

Bike nr: 6081523

City/Region: De Bilt / Holland

Mileage is: 46.000 km's

Nearly mint state. Gourgeous, smooth, classic driving in style. I should (ab)use it more. Drove it, two months ago, without any problems to environs of Lyon for a week. (Holland is a s..tcountry to drive bikes. Country is too small, too flat, roads are too straight and too busy, ...)

Repairs & modifications: None

Parts&repairs needed: None

Additional info:

Besides the r100rs I still can enjoy and appreciate my R60/6(!?). I'm getting old.

Jan Beck

bmw1@worldaccess.nl

Hello Knut,

The BMW R100RS is from 1977 it is in mint condition it has run 21.000 Km.

The frame and enginenumber is the same, the framenumber is 6081523R100RS.

The engine runs like new. I hope that you have enough information for now.

If you are interrested, we also have a 1988 and a 1980 R100RS for sale. We specialise in BMW's from R50 to R1200 cruiser, we stock a large number of original spare parts. Every year we restore a large number of old beemers (R50 etc.). Many of them we get from the USA, they are often in mint condition. Let me know if you want more information.
